newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Dec 10.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - Dec 10.

text.p: * Sprint Corp and its Global One partners, including Deutsche Telekom and France Telecom, announced a worldwide alliance to offer intranet services. The companies expect to begin trials on the service in the 1997 first quarter. Sprint closed at 39-5/8 Monday.

* Creative Biomolecules Inc said it had agreed with Biogen Inc to develop drugs to treat renal disorders. Creative Biomolecules said it could receive more than $122.5 million in investment under the pact. Creative Biomolecules closed at 10 and Biogen closed at 42.
* AT&T Corp said it is considering selling some or all of its 45.4 percent stake in LIN Television Corp. LIN closed at 41-5/8 and AT&T closed at 39-1/4.

* Excel Communications Inc said its fourth quarter earnings would fall short of analysts' estimates because of customer attrition and other problems associated with its migration to new networks. Shares closed at 28.

* Bay Networks Inc's new chief executive David House said the company's earnings would likely hold at current levels until problems with Bay's management methods were addressed. Shares closed at 24-1/2.
* Komag Inc said its fourth quarter earnings will be below expectations and below third quarter levels. Shares closed at 33-1/8.
* Netscape Communications Corp said it plans to announce today a marketing pact with five regional bell companies. Shares closed at 60.

* Black & Decker Corp said it expects its fourth quarter and full year earnings to fall short of expectations. The company also said its first quarter 1997 earnings would likely be below first quarter 1996 levels. Shares closed at 37-5/8.
